reviewText: Why oh why don't the powers that be reissue the glorious "Really Rosie"? I first saw this film in kindergarten; it taught me my ABC's (S: Shockingly Spoiled, T: Throwing Tantrums, etc.) and introduced me to the perils of eating chicken soup without checking for bones first.Thereafter I must have seen this loopy little film about a hundred times at school; my friends and I used to joke about how sick we were of it, not realizing that now, in our twenties, we'd be shelling out [lots of] bucks or more for a copy.And it's worth every penny. From the glorious ABC song "Alligators All Around" and the sad tale of "Pierre", to the anger-management advice in "Screaming and Yelling" and topping it off with a list of all the seasons you can have "Chicken Soup and Rice", "Really Rosie" is a perfect children's film. Beautiful Maruice Sendak drawings and gently goofy songs by Carole King compliment the charming, almost free-association story line.If you have kids that enjoy the unusual (no Barney!) don't hestitate to buy this movie for them, even if you've never seen it. You won't be disappointed. Take it from the Enchanted One, "Really Rosie" is a great big deal.
summary: On such an ordinary day like today...
Title: Maurice Sendak's Really Rosie VHS

reviewText: I remember this cartoon for a long time ago. Plus i read a storybook about this since the 1st grade. This cartoon been out before my time. It's so great, I gave it to my co-worker friend for her granddaughter to watch. If i ever order this again, I will definitely let my nephews watch this! Man you need to get this on DVD! This is the best educational cartoon ever! I've been searching for this for a long time! Thanks Amazon for having this!Dee SmallsDecatur,GA
summary: I love this cartoon every since i was a little kid!
Title: Maurice Sendak's Really Rosie VHS

reviewText: Back in the '70's when I was a youngster I enjoyed this television special on PBS.  Now as a parent I couldn't wait to get my hands on a copy of this video.  My child loves the songs, (I also purchased the Really Rosie Soundtrack and it's wonderful) and we watch the endearing animated story over and over again together.  The story is set on a front stoop in Brooklyn where Rosie is the Queen of her block and all her little friends and playmates gather around to put on a "show" complete with fantasy songs and make believe stories.  The entire program is filled with catchy tunes and a wonderfully told story.  This is one for your youngster's favorite video collection.  It is very hard to find but I snagged a used copy from Amazon Marketplace so don't hesitate to order if it's still available.  Enjoy!
summary: TImeless contemporary CLASSIC for kids of all ages.
Title: Maurice Sendak's Really Rosie VHS

reviewText: First of all--Carol King: brilliant. She did an incredible job of this music. Secondly--all of the songs were fantastic, we all enjoyed them. Especially my older son. When he was around five years old, he kept playing this over and over and over while we were driving for 10 hours. We told him to shut it off, we had heard it enough. But he kept going back to it. Third--as we know, the "Rosie" song is not available for release, but you can buy a DVD with the other "Nutshell" songs on it, plus "Where the Wild Things Are", and "In the Night Kitchen". It's available for only $8.99 from Amazon (prime); I already bought four copies of it. It rocks!
summary: My kids were nuts about this, and we only had the sound track!
Title: Maurice Sendak's Really Rosie VHS

reviewText: Hey everybody. There is no question that this is the greatest cartoon of all time. Check out the reviews. All 5 stars. Except for one weirdo that only gave it 4 stars. In commemoration of the greatest cartoon ever, I will do a new type of review. This show is on Youtube right now in 3 pieces. Each about 8 minutes. So I am going to open all three parts and watch them at the same time, finishing this half hour special in about 8 minutes.Here goes nothin-Lights, Action, Camera!Wow this is amazing. I am going to have watch this like a minute at a time and pause though or else I'll forget things. Anyway, you gotta try this because it is a lot of fun. So far I've got three songs going on at once. It is also strange how I decide which of the three screen to focus on. I seem to be focusing most of my attention of part 2 right now-Rosie's argument with Pierre. Also going on is the beginning, of course, and the Chicken soup song.Ok, it's been a couple minutes and strange things are happening to me! Now I watched this all the time as a kid so no doubt it deeply affected the way the Patriarch's mind developed. And it left it's marks as well. I feel myself having all these flashbacks to when I was a child. It's a very strange feeling. I feel like I did back when I was in kindergarten and first grade and stuff. This is kind of scary but no sacrifice is too great for art. Back to the show.This is scary. Now my computer is beginning to crash. It just can't take the combined power of a condensed version of the best cartoon ever! This is amazing. Well, I copy and pasted this review because if my computer crashes it will be the loss of this great experiment.Back again. Ok my computer crashed under the supreme power of this cartoon. If we could harness the power of this cartoon in condensed form, we could perhaps create a weapon of mass destruction, or since this is an educational cartoon, a weapon of mass instruction. I am going to try this one more time.Ok, I am just downright dizzy.It feels like I've been spinning around in a chair or something. I would call this experiment a success!
summary: The greatest cartoon ever! In an amazing experiment!
Title: Maurice Sendak's Really Rosie VHS
